notes.text: Updated gnutls packages that fix one bug are now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The gnutls package provides the GNU Transport Layer Security (GnuTLS) library, which provides a secure layer over a transport layer using protocols such as TLS, SSL and DTLS.

This update fixes the following bug:

* Under certain circumstances, a NULL pointer could have been dereferenced in the GnuTLS library. This caused TLS clients, such as the rsyslog utility, to terminate unexpectedly with a segmentation fault. This update adds a test condition ensuring that a NULL pointer can no longer be dereferenced and TLS clients no longer crash. (BZ#789041)

All users of gnutls are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix this bug. All applications linked with the GnuTLS library must be restarted (or the system rebooted) in order for this update to take effect.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: The _gnutls_x509_oid2mac_algorithm function in lib/gnutls_algorithms.c in GnuTLS before 1.4.2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted X.509 certificate that uses a hash algorithm that is not supported by GnuTLS, which triggers a NULL pointer dereference.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: gnutls: unknown hash algorithm NULL pointer derefence [GNUTLS-SA-2006-2]
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This issue was addressed in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 via RHBA-2012:0319: https://rhn.redhat.com/errata/RHBA-2012-0319.html

It did not affect versions of gnutls as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4 and 6.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure all previously-released errata
relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via the Red Hat Network. Details on how to
use the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/docs/DOC-11259

vulnerabilities.title: gnutls: unknown hash algorithm NULL pointer derefence [GNUTLS-SA-2006-2]
